name: Best Western Plus Oak Manor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A well mantained, clean,above average hotel. Everything worked so good. Only negative thing: you cant see the sea because of the huge casino across the street. Rooms are spacious ,extra clean , breakfast is very good with some hot stuff , the staff courteous and professional. We recommend this place.
reviews.title: Ideal place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here after we cancelled our stay at the Palace Casino Resort because of how close it is to the Beau Rivage and Hard Rock,and we were really satisfied.Our room was huge and clean,it had a mini fridge,microwave,coffee pot,and a safe(no extra cost).Most places have a per day charge if you want to use their safe,not at the Best Western,they had fresh breakfast every morning,even had bacon and breakfast sausage,our room had a balcony with a view of Beau Rivage,close by they have a Shell mini store and a Waffle House,we stayed here to attend a concert at Beau Rivage and all we had to do to get to Beau Rivage was cross the street,will stay here again.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.text: OK, so this is not a 5 star hotel but iI would give this 3 star hotel 5 stars for its category. It does have comfortable beds, the staff is helpful, the rooms were clean and since I was there on business I was very happy with those elements. The internet service was just lousy - it was so bad I couldnt upload documents that I needed to send out that night. Thats my only complaint. I would stay here again despite the internet issue because it was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Clean, comfie beds and good service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is right across the street from the Beau Rivage and not far from the Hard Rock Cafe. The parking is free. The rooms are large, very clean and have small refrigerators in them. This can be an inexpensive alternative to the $239 casino weekend rates.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were attending a concert in Biloxi in October and chose this hotel b/c of the proximity to the Beau Rivage where the show was. It was a good deal but honestly, I think I'll pay the extra money to stay at the Beau! The front desk could have cared less about us and room was below average. Bed was uncomfortable and the bathroom could have been better. I have stayed at cheaper places nicer than this place! We completely avoided the breakfast b/c it looked kind of 'yuck.' We were expecting more w/paying close to $150 a night.
reviews.title: Kind of "eh"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were on a "value" vacation. We stayed in a few hotels on the way down to Biloxi that were "scary". We crossed our fingers when checking in here, and I was so happy, I jumped on the bed! Everything was excellent. Peggy, our "breakfast lady", was an excellent hostess. She was hopping all the time to keep the guests happy. We were withing walking distance to the white sand beach and casino's. If you like crablegs, I suggest the buffett at the Beau Rivage.
reviews.title: great for the price

reviews.text: We are from the area and wanted to have a room on the parade route for Mardi Gras this year. Booking online was easy and fast, Best-Western-reward member and AAA-member friendly.
reviews.title: Great location on Mardi Gras parade route

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I checked in on my way home from work and went up to look over the room. The assigned room could have been in a little better location, and a small balcony would have been nice. I went back to the front desk and asked if there were other rooms available. Kristian at the front desk quickly and efficiently changed our room to one that fit the bill perfectly.
reviews.title: Comfortable but nothing special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived back at the hotel late Monday night and sank into the soft, comfortable beds, each adorned with four pillows. The curtains on the balcony door didn’t quite cover from end to end, so there was some light leaking in on either side. There was no noticeable cigarette smoke invading our area, even though there was what looked like cigarette chimney adjacent and below our balcony. The hotel was quiet and it was easy to sleep there.
reviews.title: It Stinks

reviews.text: We awoke to a quiet Tuesday morning in downtown Biloxi. We went to the dining area and enjoyed the various pastries, bagels, fruit, hard boiled eggs and cereals offered. Hot fresh coffee, cold milk and juices were available. Ms. Peggy was busy in the kitchen preparing waffles, hot biscuits and sausage. She was really nice.
reviews.title: Its what to expect with a Best Western

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very happy with the location of the Best Western, right opposite Beau Rivage. Our room in the block across the back was spacious and had a small balcony - although only overlooking a laneway to the side.
reviews.title: Good Value in Casino Strip

reviews.text: The bed was very comfortable. Check in/out was polite and efficient, but as it is in another building, you don't see staff in between. The breakfast room, in our building, was perhaps too small, with no spare tables when we went down and people standing eating in the hallway. Next day we went at a less popular time, and it was fine. The pool looked nice, and was popular with the kids. Parking was free and easily accessible.
reviews.title: TOMFOOLERY!!!

reviews.text: All in all we found this to be a very comfortable and convenient place to stay, at a much more reasonable price than the Casinos just across the road.
reviews.title: Great stay, exceptional service
Very nice Best Western!
reviews.text: For starters, I was traveling with my sister and a 5, 7, and two 9 yr old girls. Well I had an issue with someone (a man) trying to get into the room, luckily I had the security latch on, so he wasn't able to get in. When calling the front desk to explain what happened, the clerk said it was probably just maintenance. So I began to explain that no one knocked or announced that they were coming in. Well Sabrina (the clerk) said that they have had complaints before that employees have walked into rooms without knocking or announcing themselves. That didn't make me feel at ease. I asked Sabrina if she had children and she said, "She did and if that happened to her she would be packing her bags and leaving." Needless to say that's exactly what I did! Well the story I got a before checking out was that the man was a guest and went to the wrong door, and he told them my door was open. Tomfoolery!!! Not only was my door closed, but the security latch was on. Unfortunately my words fell on deaf ears when letting the staff know that I ABSOLUTELY had the door closed and the security latch on. The staff attempted to try to pacify me by saying that they have forgotten their door open with the latch on and blah blah blah. Tell it to someone who is crazy and deranged because I'm not that person. Maybe the clerk typed in my room number into his key, I don't know. But what I do know is that I closed and secured my door, I packed my things and went elsewhere, and that I will never go back to the Best Western Plus - Oak Manor!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Best Western Oak Manor enroute to an motorcycle conference in New Orleans. We rode in without reservations and the receptionist were very helpful in obtaining a great room. The hotel was the best accomodations of our trip.
reviews.title: Great hotel, will stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise..This hotel has been redone and it is very nice.For the money you will not beat it in this area.Every thing is in new condition and very clean and modern.There is also a free breakfast thrown in.It is also right across the street from Beau Rivage and the Hard Rock hotels for half the price.I had one minor issue I scapped my foot in the pool ,the surface is kind of like coarse sand paper.It's still healing,but I'll get over it.....
reviews.title: Shhhhhhhh keep it secret

reviews.text: The hotel is located across the street from two casinos and has a weekend rate about half that of the casinos. This is a Best Western Plus, so rooms are nice, and are well equipped. The rooms were also clean and the staff was very friendly. A complimentary breakfast comes with the room and there is a Waffle House located next door for late night or early morning appetite. A convenience store also located next door for needed or forgotten items. I'll stay here again and will recommend the hotel to anyone looking of one in this area.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.text: We needed a place to stay last min. I read the reviews and decided to give it a try...we were not disappointed. The room was spacious and clean and the balcony was a plus for me as I love to sit outside in the fresh air!! The staff was very nice and the location was great! Breakfast was one of the best i've had at a Best Western anywhere, having a large selection of hot foods! My husband had a freshly made waffle with bacon and sausage and I was impressed with the fresh blueberries! The only negative thing I can say is that the hallways reaked of smoke!!! But I would stay again if in the area!
reviews.title: Great room, Great location!

reviews.text: I assume the price was much less than the Hard Rock and Beau Rivage casinos across the street but nothing special about this place. I personally didn't like the separation of front desk/lobby from the rest of the hotel. Breakfast room was crowded, I only got juice altho the waffles looked decent (freshly made). Not bad but nothing exciting which is the case for Biloxi in general if you don't gamble. Ocean Springs was more lively.
reviews.title: All right

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Picked this BW for its location close to Casinos and the beach. Our room was large, clean and quiet with all the amenities that we needed. The staff were friendly and helpful and breakfast was very adequate. We used the swimming pool which was fine apart from our last day where a bunch of 20 year old girls were drinking alcohol in the pool shouting over their soundblaster playing loud weird music for all to hear. I think that this shouldn't be allowed in any pool area especially with young children around where people come to relax, the hotel should ban this. The price was reasonable for what you get. The area lacked the type of eating places we are comfortable with such as moderate priced family run establishments but you can always eat at the casinos for quite a bit extra. Good for the beach.
reviews.title: Good location, quiet, friendly, clean rooms

aka: Best Western Plus Oak Manor Hotel
